content:
• Friday, September 28, 2012
  • JAKK

    Shares of Jakks Pacific (NASDAQ:JAKK) trade lower after the toy maker cuts its FY12 guidance,...

    Shares of Jakks Pacific (NASDAQ:JAKK) trade lower after the toy maker cuts its FY12 guidance, saying it experienced "disappointing" domestic product sales and a slowdown in orders, as well as increased expenses. It now expects to earn between $0.68 to $0.74 per share on revenue of around $690M to $700M, down significantly from earlier estimates for a profit of $1.04 to $1.08 pre share and revenue between $720M and $728M. Shares -9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +5.2%) ended up giving back a large chunk of the gains it initially saw...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +5.2%) ended up giving back a large chunk of the gains it initially saw following yesterday afternoon's FQ2 beat. Few on the Street who are pessimistic about RIM's future seem to have changed their minds on account of the report, and many are quick to mention BlackBerry sales have become increasingly reliant on less mature, cost-sensitive markets. (more) (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM | 11 Comments
  • CHTR

    Buried within the prospectus for Time Warner Cable's (TWC) 46.4M-share public offering  of...

    Buried within the prospectus for Time Warner Cable's (TWC) 46.4M-share public offering  of Clearwire (CLWR -9.5%) stock is a disclosure that Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA) has notified Clearwire it plans to convert its 88.5M Class B shares (6.1% of all outstanding shares) into Class A shares, which it would be free to sell to the public. With Comcast having abandoned its wireless ambitions this year, it's not far-fetched to imagine some or all of those shares being sold in the near future.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM | 10 Comments
  • QLYS

    Though Qualys' (QLYS +18.1%) IPO wasn't too impressive at first, the cloud security software...

    Though Qualys' (QLYS +18.1%) IPO wasn't too impressive at first, the cloud security software firm closed the day with a hefty gain. Shares still carry a fairly moderate price/sales multiple as far as cloud names go - the fact Qualys is facing growing competition from larger security software vendors, such as Symantec and Intel's McAfee unit, could have something to do with that.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • MDRX

    Reports that Allscripts (MDRX +14.2%) is exploring a sale should not come as a big shock...

    Reports that Allscripts (MDRX +14.2%) is exploring a sale should not come as a big shock considering the calls earlier this year from major shareholder HealthCor for MDRX to put itself on the block. HealthCor has since seen three of its own nominees added to the board, which would help push the case to sell. Other medical records firms also move up: QSII +3.9%, CERN +3.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM
  • DNDN

    Dendreon (DNDN +3.8%) bucks a weak tape today after Aetna (AET -0.4%) indicated on its website...

    Dendreon (DNDN +3.8%) bucks a weak tape today after Aetna (AET -0.4%) indicated on its website that it would pay for additional prostate cancer patients to be treated with Provenge, saying it now considers it to be medically necessary for treatment.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • IRDM

    Iridium Communications (IRDM -7.1%) sells $100M of 7% Series A cumulative perpetual convertible...

    Iridium Communications (IRDM -7.1%) sells $100M of 7% Series A cumulative perpetual convertible preferred stock to support funding for its Iridium NEXT satellite constellation, and unveils plans to exchange one common share for every six outstanding $7 warrants, saying the warrant proceeds aren't needed in light of the preferred stock offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR -1.8%) says it is taking legal action to lift an injunction barring drill-rig...

    Petrobras (PBR -1.8%) says it is taking legal action to lift an injunction barring drill-rig operator Transocean (RIG -1.2%) from operating in Brazil; RIG and Chevron (CVX -0.5%) were served with the injunction yesterday. PBR currently leases eight rigs from RIG, with seven drilling off the coast of Brazil; the eighth rig is in dock.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 8 Comments
  • UBNT

    Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT +5.9%) has shot higher in afternoon trading following the release of its...

    Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT +5.9%) has shot higher in afternoon trading following the release of its 10-K. 53.2% of the controversial wireless networking hardware vendor's float was shorted as of Sep. 14.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • ADTN

    Some of the problems behind Adtran's (ADTN -10.5%) Q3 warning are company-specific, suggests...

    Some of the problems behind Adtran's (ADTN -10.5%) Q3 warning are company-specific, suggests MKM's Michael Genovese. Adtran is "under competitive attack" from Calix (CALX -2%) at rural telcos, he writes, and the company's sales to AT&T and Verizon are partly under pressure due to by declining sales of legacy hardware (presumably a reference to Adtran's T1/T3 and SONET gear). But Genovese grants the warning  will heighten near-term investor concerns about industry peers such as ALU, CIEN, and TLAB.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • TPI

    Tianyin Pharma (TPI +12.5%) trades higher today after upping FY13 guidance, despite reporting...

    Tianyin Pharma (TPI +12.5%) trades higher today after upping FY13 guidance, despite reporting lower FY 2012 results. Revenue came in at $69.6M, down from $95.2M a year ago. The company attributes the Y/Y decline to generic pricing pressure under the ongoing healthcare reform, but sees momentum going forward. For FY 2013, it expects revenue to be between $75M and $80M, higher than previous estimates. ( PR )

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • RMBS

    Rambus (RMBS +6.6%) surges after striking a 6-year patent licensing deal with Fujitsu. The...

    Rambus (RMBS +6.6%) surges after striking a 6-year patent licensing deal with Fujitsu. The deal's terms are confidential, and Rambus only says it covers "a broad range of integrated circuit products." Rambus took off earlier this week following a mixed verdict in a long-running case against SK Hynix. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • CYTX

    Maxim weighs in on Cytori Therapeutics' (CYTX +18%) new government contract, calling it a...

    Maxim weighs in on Cytori Therapeutics' (CYTX +18%) new government contract, calling it a significant strategic positive. The firm reiterates its Buy rating on the stock with a $10 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • EW

    Jefferies is upping estimates and raising its price target for Edwards Lifesciences (EW +1.6%)...

    Jefferies is upping estimates and raising its price target for Edwards Lifesciences (EW +1.6%) to $125 from $115. The firm says that recent checks with physicians on its transcatheter aortic valve replacement procedure indicated solid growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • MDRX

    Allscripts (MDRX +16%) resumes trading after a brief halt on a report they've hired Citigroup...

    Allscripts (MDRX +16%) resumes trading after a brief halt on a report they've hired Citigroup (NYSE:C) to explore a sale of the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR -3.2%) slumps after Maxim Group, which has issued plenty of bearish commentary...

    First Solar (FSLR -3.2%) slumps after Maxim Group, which has issued plenty of bearish commentary about the company, declares speculation Fist Solar will be tapped to build out NextEra Energy 1GW Blythe solar project to be unfounded. Maxim argues a recent NextEra filing merely named First Solar, which has struck deals with NextEra in the past, as a potential partner, and that the utility only plans to build out 250MW of capacity by 2016-17.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • INSM

    Insmed (INSM +9.8%) jumps after pricing its direct public offering of approximately 6.3M shares...

    Insmed (INSM +9.8%) jumps after pricing its direct public offering of approximately 6.3M shares to certain affiliates of Ayer Capital, RA Capital and Quaker Partners, at a price of $4.07 per share, whichs is at par with yesterday's closing price, and indicates strong demand for the shares. The company also disclosed that it expects to offer an additional $2M shares to another investor, which is expected to come on or before October 31.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • BYFC

    Midday top 10 gainers: BYFC +171.43%. DHRM +28.21%. CHC +22.24%. KH +21.35%. CYTX +19.17%. CT...

    Midday top 10 gainers: BYFC +171.43%. DHRM +28.21%. CHC +22.24%. KH +21.35%. CYTX +19.17%. CT +18.53%. AZZ +13.84%. NAVR +12.5%. REDF +12.14%. PCYO +11.12%.
    Top 10 Losers: CTC -16.16%. ULTR -12.27%. ASTC -10.26%. ALCS -9.42%. CRVP -9.17%. PPHM -8.86%. OTC:ASTI -8.76%. ADTN -8.66%. VSCI -8.57%. IRDM -7.76%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • ACHN

    Cowen thinks Achillion (ACHN +1.6%) is likely to be acquired by a biopharm company in need of a...

    Cowen thinks Achillion (ACHN +1.6%) is likely to be acquired by a biopharm company in need of a hep C pipeline, and considering yesterday's announcement of positive Phase 1a trial results for its drug ACH-3102, the risk/reward profile looks favorable. The company hosted an Analyst Day meeting to discuss ACH-3102 today, and Cowen thinks the company successfully made the case for differentiating it from other first generation hep C drugs.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • TOT

    Total (TOT -3.2%) expects to pump commercial oil production from its fields in Uganda to start...

    Total (TOT -3.2%) expects to pump commercial oil production from its fields in Uganda to start from 2017, a year later than previous estimates, as foreign firms charged with developing the country's energy sector try to overcome a host of issues that have delayed operations.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +5.9%) is shooting higher after launching Gifts, arguably its first serious attempt...

    Facebook (FB +5.9%) is shooting higher after launching Gifts, arguably its first serious attempt to directly profit from e-commerce. Also, Topeka writes its checks indicate Facebook's mobile Sponsored Stories ads, recently the subject of a favorable JPMorgan note, are performing well.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • CSCO

    Though many names with telecom capex exposure are off today in sympathy with Adtran, Cisco (CSCO...

    Though many names with telecom capex exposure are off today in sympathy with Adtran, Cisco (CSCO +2%) is rallying thanks to bullish Morgan Stanley remarks about enterprise/government sales. A survey of Cisco resellers found 50% reporting business has been above plan over the last 3 months, and only 7% claiming it's been below plan. Also, MS' checks indicate U.S. federal sales have been "stronger than seasonal." The firm does caution, however, that EMEA "remains a weak spot."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • HZNP

    Horizon Pharma (HZNP +2%) says it received Notices of Allowance from the U.S. Patent and...

    Horizon Pharma (HZNP +2%) says it received Notices of Allowance from the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office for two applications related to Duexis ibuprofen and famotidine tablets. Duexis is for the relief of signs and symptoms of rheumatoid arthritis and osteoarthritis and to decrease the risk of developing upper gastrointestinal ulcers.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • FINL

    Shares of Finish Line (FINL +0.1%) which were purring along nicely in premarket action dip much...

    Shares of Finish Line (FINL +0.1%) which were purring along nicely in premarket action dip much lower after execs warn on a conference call that September same-store sales are flat compared to last year. The retailer now sees company same-store sales growth in the very low single digits for H2. (webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • ADTN

    Telecom equipment and optical component names slump in response to Adtran's (ADTN -8.9%)...

    Telecom equipment and optical component names slump in response to Adtran's (ADTN -8.9%) warning. CIEN -3.1%. JNPR -2.1%. APKT -3.3%. JDSU -3.5%. FNSR -4.3%. Adtran heavily blamed its shortfall on "delays in project rollouts" from U.S. carriers. That's a familiar refrain for both Adtran and its peers. AT&T and Verizon are doing their best to restrain capex in order to boost near-term profits, and the money that they are spending is increasingly focused on their faster-growing wireless ops.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • RIG

    Transocean (RIG -1.2%) and Chevron (CVX -0.6%) are lower after Brazil told the companies to halt...

    Transocean (RIG -1.2%) and Chevron (CVX -0.6%) are lower after Brazil told the companies to halt operations in the country within 30 days (I, II), and UBS sees a $0.05/week hit to RIG's EPS. But don't panic, Tudor Pickering says: “[The] ruling has been appealed and ultimately we think this smoke clears," noting Brazil’s top oil regulator and Petrobras (PBR -2%) have backed RIG.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • STP

    Suntech (STP +4.7%) moves higher following a report banks in the company's home town of Wuxi...

    Suntech (STP +4.7%) moves higher following a report banks in the company's home town of Wuxi have extended $31.7M in in new loans. But shares are still trading at a mere $0.90 in the wake of a fraud scandal involving an affiliated investment firm. Separately, the Chinese government is taking another step to prop up its solar industry (previous), asking provinces to deliver plans for increasing solar's share of local power output.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • YUM

    Yum Brands (YUM -3.5%) moves lower after a downgrade on McDonald's and concerns on growth in...

    Yum Brands (YUM -3.5%) moves lower after a downgrade on McDonald's and concerns on growth in China - highlighted rather dramatically in Nike's earnings report - spill over to sway sentiment. Long story short, YUM shares could be in positive territory if McDonald's and Nike were firing on all cylinders.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +12.6%) remains up sharply, as shorts cover following an FQ2 beat...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +12.6%) remains up sharply, as shorts cover following an FQ2 beat fueled by (relatively) healthy emerging markets sales. Scotia Capital is upgrading RIM to Sector Perform, but most on the Street remain cautious, if not pessimistic. Jefferies thinks aggressive promotions and upgrade promotions helped drive the beat, and that ARPU suffered along the way. Sterne Agee notes receivables are down $1B over the last 2 quarters. (more) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM | 3 Comments
  • WMC

    Western Asset Mortgage (WMC -3.2%) prices a 12M share secondary  at $22.20/share...

    Western Asset Mortgage (WMC -3.2%) prices a 12M share secondary  at $22.20/share (yesterday's close: $23). Underwriters retain an option to purchase up to an additional 1.8M shares. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • ACN

    Accenture (ACN +5.5%) shoots higher after reporting largely in-line FQ4 results and boosting its...

    Accenture (ACN +5.5%) shoots higher after reporting largely in-line FQ4 results and boosting its revenue projection for the fiscal year just above the estimate of analysts. The company's total new bookings hit a record high of $9.2B during the most recent quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • CYTX

    The U.S. gives a two-year, $4.7M contract to Cytori Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CYTX) for a stem cell...

    The U.S. gives a two-year, $4.7M contract to Cytori Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CYTX) for a stem cell therapy to treat "burns caused by thermal or radioactive bombs." With key milestones, the deal could be worth $106M over five years, the company (with $10M in annual revenue) reports. CYTX +17.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM | 5 Comments
  • ASTX

    The EU puts its OK on drug Dacogen to treat a kind of leukemia, Astex Pharmaceuticals...

    The EU puts its OK on drug Dacogen to treat a kind of leukemia, Astex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ASTX) says, calling it "the world's first medicine approved and labeled specifically for elderly acute myeloid leukemia." The firm receives royalties from licensee Eisai - which has marketing and development rights in North America - and expects $17.5M in future payments if milestones continue worldwide. ASTX +9.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • ROST

    Shares of Ross Stores (NASDAQ:ROST) trade 2.1% lower premarket after the retailer gets tagged...

    Shares of Ross Stores (NASDAQ:ROST) trade 2.1% lower premarket after the retailer gets tagged with a downgrade from Buckingham Research to Neutral from Buy. The company reported a brisk back-to-school season, but analysts with Buckingham continue their theme on retail (earlier TJX) that valuations are a concern.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM

  • Corn soars 3% as the USDA announces stocks at just 988M bushels, the low end of the expected...

    Corn soars 3% as the USDA announces stocks at just 988M bushels, the low end of the expected range. Prior to the report, corn had tumbled about $1/bushel over the past month. Wheat stocks also came in low, suggesting greater-than-expected feed use for both grains. Bean stocks beat expectations after the USDA "finds" another 38M bushels from last year's crop. Wheat +2%, Beans flat.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • MNK

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR) declares its first-ever quarterly dividend of $0.20/share....

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR) declares its first-ever quarterly dividend of $0.20/share. Forward yield 4.48%. For shareholders of record Oct 31. Payable Nov 15. Ex-div date Oct 29. Shares +8% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM | 4 Comments
  • WBA

    Shares of Walgreen (WAG) fall 3.1% premarket after the company's earnings beat isn't enough to...

    Shares of Walgreen (WAG) fall 3.1% premarket after the company's earnings beat isn't enough to overcome its sluggish comparable sales numbers and rather dour outlook on consumer spending habits. Analysts continue to warn that the upside for WAG could be limited with the highly leveraged Alliance Boots deal sitting as an overhang.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM | 2 Comments
  • ADTN

    Shares of Adtran (NASDAQ:ADTN) fall 14.4% premarket after the company warns that it sees Q3...

    Shares of Adtran (NASDAQ:ADTN) fall 14.4% premarket after the company warns that it sees Q3 results below the estimates of analysts. The company cites a challenging spending environment with macroeconomic and regulatory concerns heightened.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM

  • European shares are firmly higher following Spain's latest austerity budget yesterday and ahead...

    European shares are firmly higher following Spain's latest austerity budget yesterday and ahead of the results of stress tests today about how much money the country's banks need. Euro Stoxx 50 +0.3%, London +0.4%, Paris +0.4%, Frankfurt +0.5%, Madrid +0.6%, Milan +0.3%. Spanish 10-year yields +1 bps to 5.96%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 AM

  • Optimism following Spain's budget sends Asian shares higher except in Japan, which is weighed...

    Optimism following Spain's budget sends Asian shares higher except in Japan, which is weighed down by weak industrial figures and the increasing prospect of economic contraction. Japan -0.9%, Hong Kong +0.3%, China +1.4%, India +1.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 AM
